description: Unique identifier for this miscellaneous cost transaction log entry.
Code indicating the kind of cost event (e.g., charge, credit, adjustment); typically references a lookup.
Identifier of the miscellaneous cost item being posted; links to the master cost record.
Number of units associated with the miscellaneous cost on this transaction.
Cost per unit applied for the miscellaneous cost on this transaction.
User or system account that created the transaction entry.
Associated person or vendor related to the cost; likely a foreign key to contacts; confirm with SME.
Asset or equipment ID the cost is applied to.
Maintenance procedure or task linked to the cost; likely references a procedure catalog; confirm with SME.
Project against which this cost is charged for budgeting or reporting.
General ledger account used to post this cost in financials.
Reference or flag for allocating the cost across multiple GL accounts; confirm with SME.
Work order associated with the miscellaneous cost entry.
Purchase order number related to this cost, if sourced via procurement; confirm with SME.
Timestamp when the transaction was recorded in the system.
Effective date of an adjustment for accounting or reporting purposes.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Free-text notes describing the transaction.
User-defined categorization for the cost entry; meaning may vary by configuration; confirm with SME.
Type or domain that defines how to interpret the code field; confirm with SME.
Timestamp of the most recent user-initiated change; may differ from automated updates; confirm with SME.
Likely a work order accounting or approval/posting reference; confirm with SME.
Likely the actual posted value or reference tied to the WOAP field; confirm with SME.
Likely the internal purchase order record identifier linked to this transaction; confirm with SME.
Likely the purchase receipt record identifier for received goods/services; confirm with SME.
Line number on the related purchase order.
Line number on the related purchase receipt.
User who initially created this record.
Timestamp when the record was first created.
User who last modified this record.
Timestamp of the last modification made by a user.
